intro: Andrographis nallamalayana, commonly known as the Nallamalayana bitter grass, is a perennial herb native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Andrographis nallamalayana is noted for its medicinal properties, particularly its use in traditional Ayurvedic medicine.
